@awasum this PR just passed the build, and I'll self merge it, assuming you'll have no objections. (FTR: There are still flaky test problems, this one seems to have passed more by chance, others failed; I'll follow-up.)
This failed to build again, due to flaky test which #761 will comment out...
This failed to build again, due to flaky test which #761 will comment out...

> Let's actually not merge this one until we have #764 merged and see if that (alone) helps...

@awasum #764 (re. `SchedulerJobsTest`) was not sufficient; both #757 and #760 now failed in `ClientSavingsIntegrationTest > testSavingsAccount_DormancyTracking`, so we do need this as well... I'll therefore rebase, undraft and then when it passes, self-merge this PR (based on the precedent in #764 that we accept to ignore failing test in order not to block progress on other PRs).

This one seems to have failed for other reasons than #761, perhaps my "cleanup" here wasn't all that clean? :smile: I need to look more into this, not right now but some other time, unless anyone else is interested in helping with this (this should, hopefully, be a much simpler just trivial mistake?):


```
> Task :integrationTest

org.apache.fineract.integrationtests.ClientSavingsIntegrationTest > testSavingsAccountPostInterestOnLastDayWithdrawalWithOverdraft FAILED
    java.lang.AssertionError at ClientSavingsIntegrationTest.java:1383

org.apache.fineract.integrationtests.ClientSavingsIntegrationTest > testSavingsAccountPostInterestOnLastDayWithOverdraft FAILED
    java.lang.AssertionError at ClientSavingsIntegrationTest.java:1042
```

I started this, during my testing it seems to work fine (CRUD operations over entities) but i think it need to be tested deeply to be shure that nothing is break. One little observation, in when you specify the schema name in the query, you need to add the string ?serverTimezone=UTC this in in files: fineract-provider/src/main/java/org/apache/fineract/infrastructure/core/boot/db/DataSourceProperties.java line 51 

![imagen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3644786/79618085-bf572880-80ce-11ea-853b-d961406530b4.png)

and I created he file fineract-provider/src/main/resources/sql/migrations/list_db/V1_2__updated_connection_string_option.sql

![imagen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3644786/79618142-e150ab00-80ce-11ea-8794-7fd33758ef2b.png)

I just did a quick technical review of this PR, and there is nothing shocking here, and it includes an Integration Test - this would get LGTM from me, once it actually passes the build. - It's a functional Improvement which, ideally, someone with domain expertise should review more. If we don't find anyone interested, I propose we would give this a 2 weeks grace period, and then merge if no one voices any objections....

@awasum given https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-899, any objections to merging this?

FYI @fynmanoj @maektwain @thesmallstar @xurror @DBryzz @rrpawar96 we would LOVE your help to make this flaky test more stable!!

> I'll try to make time for a more details rewiew of this (big!) PR hopefully in the coming days.

I glanced over this today, and have 1 major feedback re. the OpenJPA configuration changes proposed here (re. `EagerFetchMode` & `SubclassFetchMode`) - personally I would much prefer to see this brought up completely separately, and not "tucked away" hidden inside this PR....

Other than that, this is a (big, thank you!) functional change which others than me would be better place to review; I've just replied on the "Re: Re-opening Pull Request and Writing Test Cases for https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/527" thread on the dev list with a request for this.

@thesmallstar this failed again due to an IntegrationTest, see [FINERACT-857](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-857). Could I suggest that we please proceed as follows from now on: Any integration test failure you see in your (or anyone else's, for that matter...) PR, please from now on just search for the failing test in JIRA, comment on it like I do, and then raise a dedicated small PR to `@Ignore` the respective failing test, with a TODO for that JIRA, similar to e.g. my #761? Do that for you here for FINERACT-857, and also for me for FINERACT-855 for #779? Thanks!  /Cc @awasum FYI.

> @xurror can you locally run and fix ./gradlew rat ? Some license header is missing.

Looking into it. It's kind of weird rat-report.txt is getting checked for license.

> > the best way to get out of this impasse would probably be to contribute a fix to Flyway (an active project) or [krummas/DrizzleJDBC#46](https://github.com/krummas/DrizzleJDBC/issues/46) (dead project?).

>

That is true @percyashu, I already submited a patch for Drizzle in https://github.com/krummas/DrizzleJDBC/pull/48.

With this research I did other pull request in OpenJPA in https://github.com/apache/openjpa/commit/26b1f6be289f1eacfb72f2998c360ff6dc692920 which is now merged.

With this patched version I was able to run fineract using even MySQL 8.0.12

![imagen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3644786/79938024-0c196700-8421-11ea-8300-2678ac8d05de.png)
./gradlew rat  passes locally.

Thanks! So this is strictly required for MySQL v8? These things have a tendency to creep back in, over time... ;-) Any thoughts about how to prevent that? Would you like to try switching the Travis CI configuration to use MySQL v8?

> Thanks! So this is strictly required for MySQL v8? These things have a tendency to creep back in, over time... ;-) Any thoughts about how to prevent that? Would you like to try switching the Travis CI configuration to use MySQL v8?

Yes @vorburger , according to the MySQL reference manual GROUPING became a reserved word in 8.0.1 https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.0/en/keywords.html

![imagen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3644786/80017492-4b37ce80-849a-11ea-873d-cd69385657c2.png)

Let me make a test in a previous MySQL version using GROUPING quoted, but according to the documentation should be allowed quoted or not because in previous versions is not a reserved word.

![imagen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3644786/80017403-2ba0a600-849a-11ea-9cc7-6274a065cb2e.png)

And I think we are going to have problems in Travis CI with that switch because the current version of Drizzle. The code itself do not support the new version because little changes:
![imagen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3644786/80019194-c1d5cb80-849c-11ea-8d38-59ddc65bfee9.png)
The @@tx_isolation was renamed in 8.0+ to @@transaction_isolation and this need to be changed in Drizzle to work https://github.com/krummas/DrizzleJDBC/pull/48/commits/ccd8a2c5cd1b34c822744f0fbf276671d413e925 unfortunately as you saw, the project looks dead

Oh now this interesting. Seems .git directory cannot be found here since it is a file which is automatically ignored

This also fails with docker build.

It's hard for me to figure out how to pull this off.

I'm thinking to set the option failOnNoDotGitFound to false. @vorburger, @awasum do you think we can go with that.
This pull request seems to be stale.  Are you still planning to work on it?  We will automatically close it in 30 days.

 org.apache.fineract.integrationtests.AccountingScenarioIntegrationTest > checkPeriodicAccrualAccountingFlow FAILED
    java.lang.AssertionError at AccountingScenarioIntegrationTest.java:588

It appears to me a concurrency issue on Loan entity object and is not limited to integration tests.

@awasum do you want to review and Rebase and Merge this REVIEW change?
@awasum OK for you to merge? @nikpawar89 any objections?

The latest "force push" just now just added `@Ignore // TODO FINERACT-123` and _Of course, we very much appreciate you then jumping onto any such bugs and helping us figure out how to fix all ignored tests!_.

@xurror re. test failure, follow #782 to find FINERACT-899 and note #774, I think if you rebase this, that will disappear.

> Oh now this interesting. Seems .git directory cannot be found here since it is a file which is automatically ignored

I don't think the `.git/` _is a file which is automatically ignored_, but I suspect there are several situations where it's not present... this project certainly should still build even if there is no `.git/` directory present.  This could happen if someone builds from the Release ZIP, and a few other situations I can imagine...

> I'm thinking to set the option failOnNoDotGitFound to false. @vorburger, @awasum do you think we can go with that.

... therefore something like that would probably be acceptable / good idea; see FINERACT-911.

However I do not find an option `failOnNoDotGitFound` so I suspect this was a typo?

created FINERACT-913 so that we have a trace about this when it will get automatically closed in 30 days. @nnatarajan would you perhaps happen to have any interest to pick up and finish this, given that @wkk91193 seems to have abandoned it?
